title: American_Top_40_1986_February_15th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

This is the first time in chart history that someone ever got bounced out of the number one spot by a cousin!

Someone writes in with this question; "For the rock era, what man and what woman have had the most number one hits in any 12 month period?"

So far in the 80's, only two teen-age solo acts have hit the top 40. One of them is in this countdown.

Casey pays tribute to Janis Joplin.

He also gives a special report about a man who hit the chart as a solo act, as a duo, and as a trio, but he was the only performer each time!

One singer in the top ten grew up in a shack that his family rented for just seven dollars a month.

39: (How To Be A) Millionaire - ABC
